reference.text: means for indicating the location of accidentally buried, e.g. snow-buried persons A63B29/02

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers radar, sonar, lidar or analogous systems specifically designed for geophysical use. Radar, sonar, lidar or analogous systems, or details of such systems, if of a general interest, are also classified in subclass G01S.

In this subclass, the following term is used with the meaning indicated:"tags" means arrangements cooperating with a detecting field, e.g. near field, and designed to produce a specific detectable effect; "tags" also means active markers capable of generating a detectable field.
In this subclass, the geophysical methods apply both to the earth and to other celestial objects, e.g. planets.
Attention is drawn to the Notes following the title of class G01.

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
G01V3/11 covered by G01V3/101, G01V3/104
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.
